dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow has begun to fall and will continue to fall througho this day. King's Landing is a smoldering wreck of a city. TYRION LANNISTER steels himself and heads inside the ruin capital. We follow him Son of Saul style, tight on his fa as he passes through the gates. Where the main gate once stood there is only melted steel and crumbled stone. There is no score to soften the horror. Aside from a few distant shouts and screams, the broken city is eerily qui Much of the victorious army is behind him, but weвЂ™ll on them incidentally as he passes through the gates with a s honor guard. Smoke, shallow focus. JON SNOW and DAVOS SEAWORTH follow him with a small group NORTHMEN at their backs, but we stay with TyrionвЂ™s perspective for the whole of this opening sequence: on hi back, on his face. On the periphery of the frame, scorched bodies lie on the sides of the main street where they fell. Tyrion sees the (and Jon and Davos behind him), but they keep walking. People baked in their brick home as if in an oven. And a child sitting out front, crying, alone. Another dead child, face down on the ground. A NORTHERN SOLDIER sits on a pile of rubble in front of a stairwell, weeping amongst the wreckage. Human silhouettes on the dragon-scorched ground where the ashes have blown away, the negative image of the Hiroshim silhouettes. A WALKING WOUNDED MAN passes without acknowledging Tyrion his party. As if he does not even see them. A small, charred hand pokes out from underneath the rubbl holding a tin horse. The same little girl Arya tried to h in 805. They all stop to look at what remains of the dead little girl. Tyrion glances at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I'll find you later.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Let me send some of my men with you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon gestures to his men to go with Tyrion, but:

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m going alone. Tyrion stares at Jon for a beat. He outranks everyone her Jon finally nods and steps aside. Jon watches him walk through an archway framing the devastation beyond. We tilt up to reveal the distant Red Keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, Davos and the Northmen come across GREY WORM and a platoon of Unsullied standing over a group of LANNISTER OFFICERS on their knees.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: In the name of the one true queen, Daenerys Targaryen, I sentence you to die.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Grey Worm! Grey Worm turns and watches Jon approach. He seems neithe surprised nor pleased to see his queenвЂ™s lover.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s over. These men are prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: It is not over until the queenвЂ™s enemies are defeated.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: (incredulous) How much more defeated do you want them to be? TheyвЂ™re on their knees!

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: They are breathing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: Look around you, friend. We won.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: I follow my queenвЂ™s commands. Not yours.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: And what are the queenвЂ™s commands?

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: вЂњKill all those who follow Cersei Lannister.вЂќ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 3.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Grey Worm draws his knife.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: These are free men. They chose to fight for her. As Grey Worm steps behind the first officer in the line, grabs his arm. A dozen Unsullied level their spears at Jon. The Northmen behind Jon draw their swords, prepared to de their commander.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: Easy, men! Easy! Grey Worm pulls his arm free and stares at Jon. He is qui ready to fight the Northerner if further provoked. Jon stares back, but unlike Grey Worm he is plagued with doubt. These men are his allies. How did it come to this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: (to Jon) We should speak to the Queen. Jon hates to walk away from what he considers an injustic but the only other choice is even greater bloodshed. He walks away, turning once to see Grey Worm cut the firs officerвЂ™s throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrion walks past the ruined map room, snow starting to c the ash and rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks past the table where he and Cersei often fought, past the little office where he and his father often foug He grabs an unlit torch from a sconce. He's heading into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TUNNELS- DAY
dialogues.text: Alone and carrying a lit torch, Tyrion makes his way down staircase into the secret underbelly of the Red Keep. At the end of the dark tunnel he comes upon a great mound rubble, blocking his passage. He raises his torch and see small gap at the very top of the rubble. It is lighter on other side than it is here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 4.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He puts down the torch and starts climbing up the rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrion walks through what's left of the dragon skull room toward the light provided by the hole that Drogon blasted the ceiling. Many of the skulls have been crushed by falling rock; eve Balerion the Dread's skull has been caved in. All of the skulls have been blackened and scorched by the extreme he of the fires that raged for hours. And then he sees it, in the pile of rubble and ash made b DrogonвЂ™s blast: A hint of a golden hand. Tyrion gets down on his knees and clears the rubble and a away. It's hard, filthy work. Tyrion starts to cry midway throu but doesnвЂ™t stop until heвЂ™s cleared away the remains and Cersei. They are still in each other's arms: his golden hand rest beside her head; her lion pendant still encircling her ne Tyrion sits beside the remains of his brother and sister cries for them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High atop Aegon's Hill, we follow ARYA STARK as she heads toward the plaza. She passes a group of Unsullied as they toss dead Lannister bodies in a pile, stacking them like cordwood. Reaching the edge of the plaza, she stays on the edge of proceedings, observing from a distance. Targaryen imagery is on display here: the big red and bla dragon banners have been draped over the walls. Unsullied line both sides of the steps, with Grey Worm waiting up top. All the remaining Unsullied are in format in front of the steps. Behind them, the Dothraki congregate, some with their hor some on foot. And behind the Dothraki, at the main entrance to the plaz opposite the steps, Jon enters into the space. Arya sees (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We go to Jon as he looks across the crowd to the staircas and the wrecked facade that frames the top of it. The wre Red Keep visible in the distance. We follow Jon as he makes his way through the Dothraki, t to the aisle in the Unsullied ranks that leads to the staircase. Jon sees Grey Worm standing at the top of the steps, star down at him. They both look up when they hear the heavy beat of dragon wings. Drogon flies overhead, over Dothraki waving their arakhs Unsullied standing motionless, spears in hand. Drogon lands out of sight beyond the top of the stairs. J climbs the stairway. When he nears the top he sees Dany, already dismounted, walking towards him. For a moment, DrogonвЂ™s unfolding wings spread behind her back, an unsettling image. Her Satanic MajestyвЂ™s Request. She walks to the edge of the steps and looks out over her gathered armies, over the demolished city. First she addresses her Dothraki in their native tongue.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Qoy goyi! Shafka vernish ei asqoy shafki anhaan. Shafka addrivish dozge anni ma khogaroon shigethi mori! (Blood of my blood! You kept all your promises to me. You killed my enemies in their iron suits!) The Dothraki scream and raise their arakhs into the air. have some badass-looking Dothraki in the mix.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Shafka ohharish okrenegwin mori! (You tore down their stone houses!) Her khalasar roars.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Shafka ray azhish anhaan Rhaeshis Andahli! (You have given me the Seven Kingdoms! ) Her Dothraki scream and wave their arakhs. Jon watches all this, disturbed. Next Dany addresses her Unsullied in Valyrian, first turn to Grey Worm. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 6.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Torgo Nudho, hin Rangam ez Hozno ynoma dekurupta. Nedyro mentyro hedry pasabarje karaje iksa. Avy tolvio azantyro flurho jentosy brozan. Dario Vilibazmaro Aeksyso. (Torgo Nudho, you have walked beside me since the Plaza of Pride. You are the bravest of men, the most loyal of soldiers. I name you commander of all my forces, the QueenвЂ™s Master of War.) Grey Worm bows his head, acknowledging this high honor. Tyrion approaches from the Red Keep side, looking shaken despondent. Jon glances at him. Tyrion doesnвЂ™t look at Jon, or at DanyвЂ™s gathered for is trapped inside his own head, thinking about what he ju saw. Dany turns to the Unsullied foot soldiers standing down i the plaza.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Dovaogedys! Jeme hen mufioti fioghoti nadintaks se hae buzdaryti ubredaks. Sir daeremirossa iksat! Daro Vililio gierion hen qrinio hilmiot daeredat! (Unsullied! All of you were torn from your mothersвЂ™ arms and raised as slaves. Now you are liberators! You have freed the people of KingвЂ™s Landing from the grip of a tyrant!) The Unsullied slam their spear butts onto the ground, thr times in perfect synch, affirming their pride in their achievement and their queen.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Yn vilibazma tetos daor. Ilvra egralbri qubemiluty daor yn vapar tolvio vyho gieryndi daeredoty! Hen Vinterveli va Dornot, hen Laniso Viliniot va Qarthot, hen Jaedria va Zeo Embrot, abrar, valar, rifiar toli grevo go bottis. Grevi ynoma pryjelat? (But the war is not over. We will not lay down our spears until we have liberated all the people of the world! (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 7.

dialogues.speaker: DANY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From Winterfell to Dorne, from Lannisport to Qarth, from the Summer Isles to the Jade Sea, women, men, and children have suffered too long beneath the wheel. Will you break the wheel with me?) The Unsullied slam their spear butts onto the ground, aga and again, eager for the fight. Tyrion, who understands enough Valyrian to get the gist o what she's saying, looks around the ruined city. If this liberation, he doesn't believe in liberation theology. The Unsullied continue to drum the butts of their spears the ground in unison, praising their queen. Amidst the ashes of her conquest and the corpses of her enemies, Dany accepts the worship of her followers. The devastated city stretches out below her, but she shows no signs of ambivalence or doubt. She has burned the village save it. Arya watches from afar, cool and hooded, appraising Dany her forces. Arya hated Cersei as much as anyone. That doe mean she likes the new boss. To her it looks like the Sev Kingdoms just traded one tyrant for another. Dany turns to Tyrion. We begin to fade down on the drumming spears.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: You freed your brother. You committed treason. Tyrion sees no point in arguing his case. He looks around ruined city. He begged her not to do this, and she did it anyway. Hund of thousands have died. He wanted a bloodless revolution. He would have gladly di to put her on the throne without the horror they just witnessed. But he failed.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I freed my brother. And you slaughtered a city. He steps forward to the edge of the landing, removes his pin and tosses it down the steps. The spear butting stops abruptly. Thousands of DanyвЂ™s l warriors stare up at this man who dares to disrespect the queen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: At one point, this betrayal would have hurt Dany deeply. point is long gone. She stares at her former Hand with an disgusted that she trusted him so deeply for so long.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Ziry najikatas. (Take him.) Grey Worm and a posse of Unsullied follow out the order a Jon watches in disbelief. Dany walks toward the Red Keep, flanked by a large contin of her Dothraki bodyguards. Jon is so distracted by what heвЂ™s just seen that he doe notice Arya now standing beside him. Jon looks at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I came to kill Cersei. Your queen got there first.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s everyoneвЂ™s queen, now. AryaвЂ™s expression is noncommittal.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Try telling Sansa. Jon needs to go deal with matters, now.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Wait for me outside the city. I'll find you. Before he can take a step, Arya grabs his arm and looks u him.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Jon. No one else is close enough to hear their words.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: She knows who you are. Who you really are. You'll always be a threat to her. Arya looks to Dany, walking away with her Dothraki bodygu

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: And I know a killer when I see one.  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Unsullied have found a makeshift cell for Tyrion somewhere on the Red Keep grounds. Perhaps it's one of th few intact chambers. Tyrion sits with his back against the wall, staring up at weak light. We hear the bolt slide and the door opens: Jon Snow stand there. He nods to the Unsullied sentries and steps inside One of the sentries closes the door after him and we hear bolt slide.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Did you bring any wine?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Ah. Well, thank you for coming to see me. (beat) Our queen doesnвЂ™t keep prisoners for long.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I suppose thereвЂ™s a crude kind of justice. I betrayed my closest friend and watched him burn. Now VarysвЂ™ ashes can tell my ashes, вЂњSee! I told you.вЂќ Jon is unable to see the humor in the situation.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: It just occurred to me: IвЂ™m talking to the only man alive who knows where IвЂ™m going. So? Is there life after death?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Not that IвЂ™ve seen. Tyrion takes this with his usual fatalism.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I should be thankful. Oblivion is the best I can hope for. I strangled my lover. I shot my own father with a crossbow. I betrayed my queen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 10.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You didnвЂ™t--

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I did. And I'd do it again, now that IвЂ™ve seen what IвЂ™ve seen. (shrugs ) I chose my fate. The people of King's Landing did not. Jon cannot argue with this. He's seen too much horror in last day. He glances towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t justify what happened. I won't try. But the war is over now.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Is it? When you heard her talking to her soldiers, did she sound like someone who's done fighting? Jon doesnвЂ™t answer, but his expression makes it clear h harbors the same worry.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s a conqueror. She liberated the people of Slaver's Bay. She liberated the people of King's Landing. She'll go on liberating until all the people of the world are free... and she rules them all.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: And you've been by her side, counseling her. Until today.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Until today. (beat) Varys was right. I was wrong. It was vanity to think I could guide her. Our queenвЂ™s nature is fire and blood.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (angry) You think our house words are stamped on our bodies when we're born and thatвЂ™s who we are? Then I'd be fire and blood, too. (quieter) SheвЂ™s not her father. No more than you're Tywin Lannister. Tyrion considers this point. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 11.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: My father was an evil man. My sister was an evil woman. Pile up all the bodies of all the people they ever killed. Throw in Ramsay Bolton's victims for good measure. Add them all up, and they still won't be half as many as our beautiful queen slaughtered in a single day. A million people lived in this filthy city before we attacked. How many are living now? The argument gets more heated, both men impassioned.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Cersei left her no choice--

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: The moment the gates fell the battle was over. She burned families alive in their homes.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: She saw her best friend beheaded. She saw her dragon shot out of the sky. Your sister betrayed her.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: And she burnt down a city for it!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s easy to judge when you're standing far from the battlefield--

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Would you have done it?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You've been up there, on a dragonвЂ™s back. YouвЂ™ve had that power. Would you have burnt the city down?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Yes, you do. You wonвЂ™t say it because you donвЂ™t want to betray her. But you know.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What does it matter, what I would do? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 12.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: It matters more than anything. Tyrion looks up at Jon. ItвЂ™s important that Jon listens Tyrion makes sure he is before beginning his argument.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: When she murdered the slavers of Astapor, IвЂ™m sure no one but the slavers complained. After all, they were evil men. When she crucified hundreds of Meereenese nobles, who could argue? They were evil men. The Dothraki khals she burnt alive? They would have done worse to her. Everywhere she goes, evil men die and we cheer her for it. And she grows more powerful, and more sure that she is Good and Right. (beat) She believes her destiny is to build a better world, for everyone. To fix what is broken for every man, woman and child. If you believed that, if you truly believed it... wouldnвЂ™t you kill whoever stands between you and paradise? The two men are silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I know you love her. I love her, too. Not as successfully as you. But I believed in her with all my heart. (beat) Love is more powerful than reason. We all know that. Look at my brother. Jon remembers what Aemon told him so many years ago.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: вЂњLove is the death of duty.вЂќ The words surprise Tyrion.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You just came up with that?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Maester Aemon said it. Tyrion nods, thinking about it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 13.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Sometimes duty is the death of love. вЂњYou are the shield that guards the realm of men.вЂќ YouвЂ™ve always tried to do the right thing. Always, no matter the cost, youвЂ™ve tried to protect people. Who is the greatest threat to the people now? He lets Jon think about that for a moment. Tyrion looks old and weary as he admits the great failure his life.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You won't be able to hold her in check. You wonвЂ™t be able to guide her. I thought I could. I thought she'd listen to me. I was wrong. (beat) YouвЂ™re the last hope. Jon realizes that Tyrion is overtly asking him to turn on Dany.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I know. (beat) ItвЂ™s a terrible thing IвЂ™m asking. ItвЂ™s also the right thing. (beat) You think IвЂ™m the last man sheвЂ™1l execute? If you donвЂ™t stop her, everyone who stands against her will share my fate. And who is more dangerous than the rightful heir to the Iron Throne? Jon shakes his head. HeвЂ™s long past caring about himsel his personal safety.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: If thatвЂ™s her decision... sheвЂ™s the queen. He looks around the cell.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry it came to this. He knocks on the door of the cell and waits for the Unsul to come get him.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: And your sisters? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 14.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon turns to look at Tyrion. He doesnвЂ™t care about his skin but his sisters -- thatвЂ™s a very different matter.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: They're both as stubborn as their mother ever was. Do you see them bending the knee? Sansa swearing eternal loyalty to a queen she neither likes nor trusts? Jon's response is neither convinced nor convincing:

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: My sisters will be loyal to the Throne. We hear the footsteps of the Unsullied approaching the ce

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Why do you think Sansa told me the truth about you? Because she doesnвЂ™t want Dany to be queen--

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t get to choose!

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: No. But you do. (beat) And you have to choose now. We hear the bolt slide and the door opens. Jon stares at Tyrion for a beat and walks out. The door shuts. The bolt slides. And Tyrion waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon walks through the ruins of the Red Keep. The approach to the throne room is lined with Unsullied, dozens of them. None of them stop Jon. They all know who is, and what he means to their queen. The red-and-black Targaryen banners hang at regular intervals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning a corner, Jon arrives at the building that houses throne room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon looks up at the wreckage, then down to the entryway; looks a bit like the frontage of a cathedral wrecked in t Blitz, surrounded by monumental chunks of fire-blackened masonry. But the doors are intact. Jon steps forward, but stops. Amidst the mountains of black rubble, Drogon lies next to entrance, cleaning his claws with his long tongue. HeвЂ™s been hidden in plain sight for much of this time, dusty black scales almost a part of the rubble. Jon takes a deep breath and heads for the doors. Drogon sees him. He lifts his head, blocking the way. The massive dragon stares at the diminutive man, studying with eyes that seem just as intelligent as Jon's own. For a long, tense beat, Drogon considers this suitor for mother's attentions. His head comes in close. He takes a big sniff. Jon is a friend, not a threat. DrogonвЂ™s head snakes awa back to his claws to resume his cleaning. Jon walks past the dragon and into the keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dany stands in the Throne Room. It looks just like it did her vision, only the area behind the Iron Throne has been destroyed altogether. I.e., no window behind throne, Lannister or otherwise. The snow falls lightly through the collapsed roof as she steps past the pillars, down the central aisle. Rubble fr the fallen roof is visible on the floor, covered in a lay of snow. For a few seconds, the conquering queen disappears and sh looks like a young girl again, entranced by the beauty of moment, and the object of her greatest desire. It is right there. The reason for her long journey across continents, the endless conflicts, the deaths of her love ones: The Iron Throne. She slowly climbs the snow-covered stairs. She reaches out to touch it, and hesitates. Perhaps she remembers the vision in which the throne was a temptation avoid. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But this isnвЂ™t a vision. This is real. She touches the the throne, resting her hand on the cold metal where so m of her ancestorsвЂ™ hands rested for so many centuries. She is standing directly in front of it. All she has to d sit and the journey is complete. She turns to sit. In doing so, she sees Jon enter the thr room. The throne can wait. She steps down to meet him on the fl in front of the throne platform. Dany is at ease for the first time in as long as we can remember. Maybe the first time ever. She has won. She looks back at the throne.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: When I was a girl, my brother told me it was made with a thousand swords from AegonвЂ™s fallen enemies. She smiles at the memory as she turns back to Jon.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: What do a thousand swords look like in the mind of a little girl who canвЂ™t count to twenty? I imagined a mountain of swords too high to climb. So many fallen enemies you could only see the soles of AegonвЂ™s feet. (beat) But many years later, I saw it. The real thing.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: In a vision. The roof, the snow, the throne... (beat) It all looked exactly like this. In this room, at this very moment, the sense of DanyвЂ™s destiny is pervasive. Shattering its spell is difficult. Jon does, because he has to.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I saw them executing Lannister prisoners in the street. They said they were acting on your orders. She can see that Jon is deeply troubled. She does not condescend. On the contrary, she loves him for it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 17.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: It was necessary. But Dany hasnвЂ™t seen the things Jon has seen, on the gr

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Have you been down there? Have you seen? Dany has not. Thinking about it, Jon is shaken.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Children. Little children, burned.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: I tried to make peace with Cersei. And she used their innocence as a weapon against me. She thought it would cripple me, leave me unable to do what needed to be done. (beat) She left me no choice. Jon takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: And Tyrion?

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: He conspired behind my back with my enemies. How have you treated people whoвЂ™ve done the same to you? Even when it broke your heart?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Forgive him.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You can. You can forgive all of them. Make them see that they made a mistake. Make them understand. Looking at her, his need to believe is almost overwhelmin

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Please, Dany. She considers his plea for clemency for a long moment. Bu she cannot grant it.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: We canвЂ™t hide behind small mercies. The world we need wonвЂ™t be built by men loyal to the world we have. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 18.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: The world we need is a world of mercy. It has to be. She starts to close the gap between them.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: It will be. She takes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not easy to see something thatвЂ™s never been before. A good world.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How do you know? (off her questioning look) That it will be good?

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Because I know what is good. I know what is right. (beat) And so do you. Jon shakes his head. HeвЂ™s near tears now, struggling to it together.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: You do. YouвЂ™ve always known. He looks into the eyes of the woman he loves.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What about everyone else? All the other people who think they know whatвЂ™s good and right? The fire of the conqueror flares in DanyвЂ™s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: They donвЂ™t get to choose. Jon understands what this means for the people he loves t most. She puts her hands on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DANY
dialogues.text: Be with me, build the new world with me. This is our reason, it has been from the beginning. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 19.

dialogues.speaker: DANY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since you were a little boy with a bastardвЂ™s name, and I was a little girl who couldnвЂ™t count to twenty. We do it together. We break the wheel together. Jon nods.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You are my Queen, now and always. Standing before the Iron Throne, Dany steps forward and kisses the man she loves. A perfect kiss, an expression o pure love and passion. We push in on them until weвЂ™re tight on their faces -- eyes closed, his hand behind her head, her hand on his ch DanyвЂ™s eyes open suddenly as she draws a sharp breath. Jon's eyes open as well, already filling with tears. For moment, neither moves, as if moving will make this real. In a wider angle, we see Jon with his hand still on the h of the dagger he just lodged in DanyвЂ™s heart. Her strength leaves her and she collapses to the marble; keeps her in his arms as she falls, kneeling down to the floor beside her. He looks down at what heвЂ™s done. Terrible. And necessar hopes for one last moment with her. But her eyes are already glazing over. Winter has come to Throne Room. Dany lies dead in his arms, Pieta-style, as snow drifts down. Jon buries his head next to hers and cries. His mourning is brought to an end by the sound of beating wings, coming closer, and a great roar. Jon looks to the place the ceiling used to be, and sees Drogon wheeling in the sky, heading for the Throne Room. Drogon lands before him, shaking the throne roomвЂ™s foundations. His wings fall to his side, displacing enoug air that Jon has to steel himself against the gust. Jon doesn't flee. He has no interest in avoiding death; h has nothing left to live for. He stands and steps away fr DanyвЂ™s body. Drogon moves his head close to DanyвЂ™s body. He sniffs a He nudges her gently. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 20.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DrogonвЂ™s huge brow lowers and his pupils dilate as the is confirmed. His lips raise over teeth as long as short swords. The dragon rises up on his hind legs, towering over Jon. In a beautiful, terrifying tableaux, he roars to the sky, embodiment of rage. He looks down at Jon. We see the fire build up in his thr Jon sees it as well. He prepares to die. But the blast is not for him. Drogon wants to burn the wo but he will not kill Jon. He breathes fire on the back wall, blasting down what rem of the great red blocks of stone. We look over JonвЂ™s shoulder as the fire sweeps toward t throne-- not the target of DrogonвЂ™s wrath, just a dumb bystander caught up in the conflagration. We look through the blades of the throne as the flames en it, and blast the wall behind it. We see the throne in the flames, turning red, then white, then beginning to lose its form. We get tight shots of the details melting in silhouette: armrests, the iconic fan of swords on the backrest. The fire stops. The smoke clears revealing a puddle of smouldering slag where the throne once stood. Who will sit on the Iron Throne? No one. Drogon turns back to DanyвЂ™s lifeless body and delicatel gathers her up with a claw. With heavy thrusts of his wings, Drogon takes to the air, flies away through the missing roof. Jon watches him recede, with his motherвЂ™s corpse in his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Drogon over the ruined city with Dany's lifeles body clutched in his claw. He heads out toward the eastern sky, flying over Blackwat Bay. ItвЂ™s not a dusky beauty shot; itвЂ™s gray and life befits a funeral. We fade to black.  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 21. INT. TYRIONвЂ™S CELL - DAY Tyrion is in a proper cell now, as befits a condemned man The intervening weeks have been hard ones; he hasnвЂ™t sl bathed or eaten well in a long time. His beard is longer, hair matted down and filthy. He sits on the ground in the half light and thinks about enormity of all that has happened, and his role in it. He has no plans, no wants, no desire to effect change or avoid suffering. He failed. He is finished. The bolt slides and the door opens. Grey Worm has come fo him, with four Unsullied. He does not tell Tyrion where h going, and Tyrion does not ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey Worm leads a manacled Tyrion down Red Keep corridors with the Unsullied behind them. Is Tyrion heading to his death? HeвЂ™1ll find out soon enough. Tyrion walks toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the entryway to the Dragonpit, Tyrion walks between tw lines of Unsullied with Grey Worm still at his side. [The number of Unsullied has grown, to about 20.] Tyrion looks at the crumbled walls rising up on either si of him, still patched with snow on the top. The landscape is showing signs of a thaw. Weeks have pass since the day of DanyвЂ™s assassination. Tyrion looks to Grey Worm, who stares straight ahead. Tyrion faces forward as they emerge into the Dragonpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most powerful lords and ladies of Westeros are here, representing all Seven Kingdoms, sitting in similar circumstances to the summit meeting in 707, though arraye a semicircle. When they see Tyrion and the Unsullied, they all stand. T tension is palpable. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 22.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Present are: The Lady of Winterfell and Wardenness of the North, SANSA STARK, who sits in the middle of the semicir Arya and BRAN STARK sit to her right. To her left: the On Knight, Davos. The Lord of the Vale and Warden of the East, ROBIN ARRYN, with LORD ROYCE beside him. The Lady of the Iron Islands, YARA GREYJOY. The Lord of t Stormlands and Warden of the South, GENDRY BARATHEON. The lord of the Riverlands, EDMURE TULLY. The new PRINCE OF DORNE. BRIENNE OF TARTH. SAMWELL TARLY. A smattering of ND lords And behind them all, and on either side, lining the walls the Dragonpit: sixty Unsullied. A show of force that leav no doubt as to who controls KingвЂ™s Landing. Grey Worm leads Tyrion up onto the platform. For a moment there is silence. Tyrion and Sansa look at each other for a beat before San sits. The other lords follow suit. She turns to Grey Worm

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Where is Jon?

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: We have him. He is our prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: So is Lord Tyrion. They were both to be brought to this gathering.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: We will decide what we do with our prisoners. This is our city now.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: If you look outside the walls of your city, you'll find thousands of Northmen who will explain to you why harming Jon Snow is not in your interest.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: And you will find thousands of Unsullied who believe that it is. Some murmurs of support. And some dissent. Yara stands:

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Some of you may be quick to forgive. The Ironborn are not. I swore to follow Daenerys Targaryen. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 23.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: You swore to follow a tyrant.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: She freed us from a tyrant. Cersei is gone because of her. And Jon Snow put a knife in her heart. Let the Unsullied give him what he deserves.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: Say another word about killing my brother and IвЂ™1l1 cut your throat. Yara opens her mouth to respond but sees the look on Arya face. Yara is as tough as they come, but Arya-- AryaвЂ™s different. She sits as Davos stands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: Friends. Please. WeвЂ™ve been cutting each otherвЂ™s throats long enough. (to Grey Worm) Torgo Nudho... am I saying that properly? Grey Worm just stares back at him, giving him nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: If it werenвЂ™t for you and your men, we would have lost the war with the dead. This country owes you a debt we can never repay. (beat) But let us try. He looks to the men and women around him, then proceeds w the proposition theyвЂ™ve discussed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s land in the Reach, good land. The people who used to live there are gone. Make it your own. Start your own House, with the Unsullied as your bannermen. (beat) WeвЂ™ve had enough war. Thousands of you, thousands of them... you know how it ends. We need to find a better way.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: We do not need payment. We need justice. All of us who owe our lives and freedom to Daenerys Stormborn need justice. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 24.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jon Snow killed our Queen. He cannot go free.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not for you to decide. These are the first words Tyrion has spoken. Everyone tur to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: You are not here to speak. Everyone has heard enough words from you.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You're right. And no oneвЂ™s any the better for it. (beat) But itвЂ™s not for you to decide. Sansa is pleased, until he turns to her:

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: And itвЂ™s not for you to decide, either.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Who, then?

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: The rightful ruler of Westeros. Jon Snow committed his crime here. His fate is for our king to decide. Or our queen.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: We donвЂ™t have a king or queen. TyrionвЂ™s gaze passes over the assembled lords and ladie

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You're the most powerful people in Westeros. Choose one. Tyrion looks up at his keeper, Grey Worm. Grey Worm does not trust anything Tyrion says or does. Bu looks to the lords and ladies.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: Make your choice, then. Everyone looks at everyone else. This is not what they ca here to do. But they donвЂ™t appear to have any better op Edmure stands proudly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 25.

dialogues.speaker: EDMURE
dialogues.text: My lords and ladies. I suppose this is the most important moment of our lives. What we decide today will reverberate through the annals of history. I stand before you as one of the senior lords in the country, a veteran of two wars. I'd like to think my experience has led to some small skill in statecraft and-

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Uncle. Edmure is a little annoyed to be cut off in mid-flow, especially by his niece.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Please sit. Edmure can't quite believe what he's seeing, but the chuc and suppressed grins of the other lords make him realize his newborn hopes of being king were just squashed by a g He sits. A tense silence as various lords and ladies glance around circle, wondering who will vie for power next.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: We have to choose someone.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: Why just us? Everyone looks at Samwell. He stands uncomfortably, steel himself and soldiers on.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: We represent all the great houses. But whomever we choose, they wonвЂ™t just rule over lords and ladies. Maybe the decision about what's best for everyone should be left to... well, everyone. The attending lords and ladies stare at him for an incredulous moment before breaking out into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: EDMURE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should give the dogs a vote as well.

dialogues.speaker: ROYCE
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ll ask my horse! They laugh at Sam until he sits back down. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 26.

dialogues.speaker: EDMURE
dialogues.text: (to Tyrion) I suppose you want the crown?

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Me? The Imp? Half the people hate me for serving Daenerys. The other half hate me for betraying her. I canвЂ™t think of a worse choice.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: Who, then? Tyrion has no immediate answer. No one else does, either. Grey Worm grows impatient.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve had nothing to do but think these past few weeks. About our bloody history. About the mistakes we've made. He looks from face to face.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: What unites people? Armies? Gold? Flags? (shaking his head) Stories. There is nothing in the world more powerful than a good story. Nothing can stop it, no enemy can defeat it. (beat) And who has a better story than Bran the Broken? With astonishment, all the gathered lords turn to look at Bran, sitting in his wheelchair. Sansa and Arya look more shocked than anyone. Bran doesnвЂ™t look shocked. Simply uninterested. But tha doesnвЂ™t bother Tyrion.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: The boy who fell from a high tower and lived. He knew heвЂ™d never walk again. So he learned to fly. All of the gathered lords and ladies study Bran as Tyrion speaks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 27.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: He crossed beyond the Wall -- a crippled boy -- and became the Three Eyed Raven. He is our memory, the keeper of all our stories -- all the tragedy, all the comedy, the wars, the weddings and births and massacres and famines. Our triumphs. Our defeats. Our past. (beat) Who better to lead us into the future? As Tyrion speaks, Bran looks down at the armrest of his wheelchair. A tiny pill bug crawls along the wood.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Bran has no interest in ruling. And he canвЂ™t father children. Bran puts his hand down and lets the bug crawl into his p

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Good. HeвЂ™1ll never thrust his awful spawn upon us to rule after he dies. Tyrion looks up at Grey Worm, still standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: That is the wheel our queen wanted to break. As much as Grey Worm hates it, he knows Tyrion is at leas partly right.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: From now on, when a monarch dies, the lords of Westeros can gather on this spot and pick the next one, just as weвЂ™re doing now. Nods all around display general consensus on this notion. Tyrion looks at Bran.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I know you donвЂ™t want it. I know you donвЂ™t care about power. But I ask you now: if we choose you, will you wear the crown? Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms, to the best of your abilities, from this day until your last day? Bran sets his hand back on the arm rest and lets the pill crawl off and resume his journey. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finally Bran looks around, at all the important people waiting to hear his decision. He looks at Tyrion. Bran doesnвЂ™t really smile anymore but there is the smal hint of amusement on his face as he answers.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Why do you think I came all this way? A strange response but Tyrion has come to expect strange answers from Bran.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: To Brandon of House Stark, first of his name, I say: Aye. Tyrion looks around the circle. Edmure is still be miffed he wasn't given serious consideration, but he expects he'll have influence at cou if his crippled nephew is ruling.

dialogues.speaker: EDMURE
dialogues.text: Aye. Gendry is happy to go along.

dialogues.speaker: GENDRY
dialogues.text: Aye. Yara has heard that her brother died defending Bran. She knows this choice would make Theon happy.

dialogues.speaker: YARA
dialogues.text: Aye. Brienne is a Stark loyalist and represents House Tarth.

dialogues.speaker: BRIENNE
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not sure I get a vote. But aye. One by one, the lords of Westeros express their support f Bran. Tyrion is very pleased. Finally, it comes to Sansa. She does not address Tyrion. turns and speaks directly to Bran.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: I love you, little brother. I always will. YouвЂ™1l be a good king. (beat) But tens of thousands of Northmen fell in the Great War, defending all of Westeros. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 29.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And those who survived have seen too much and fought too hard ever to kneel again. (beat) The North will remain an independent kingdom, as it was for thousands of years. Arya smiles. Tyrion is stunned but also a little impressed. He looks t Bran. Everyone in attendance, the most powerful men and women i Westeros, they all look to their new king, eager to see h he handles the first crisis of his reign. Bran watches Sansa for a beat. He nods. Tyrion looks around for objections or further secessions. Yara? Gendry? Edmure? None of them speak.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: All hail Bran the Broken, First of his Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Six Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm. All stand and shout BranвЂ™s name:

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: All hail Bran the Broken! For the first time in a long time, Tyrion dares to feel a tiny bit good about something. Until:

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Lord Tyrion. You will be my Hand. Tyrion truly hates this suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: No, your grace. I donвЂ™t want it.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: And I donвЂ™t want to be king.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t deserve it. I thought I was wise, but I wasnвЂ™t. I thought I knew what was right, but I didnвЂ™t. Choose Ser Davos, choose anyone else... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 30.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: I choose you. Grey Worm protests:

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: You cannot.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Yes I can. IвЂ™m King. Grey Worm pulls a still-manacled Tyrion closer.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: This man is a criminal. He deserves justice.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: He just got it. HeвЂ™s made many terrible mistakes. HeвЂ™s going to spend the rest of his life fixing them. Grey Worm is not sold. He looks right at Bran.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: It is not enough. Tyrion looks to Bran as well. His life depends on the new kingвЂ™s response to this impasse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon looks ragged. He hasnвЂ™t slept, hasnвЂ™t eaten, hasn bathed. He looks like a man who doesnвЂ™t care whether he or dies. Tyrion has been explaining the outcome of the kingsmoot t Jon, who barely seems to listen.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Giving you to the Unsullied for execution would start a war. Letting you walk free would start a war. Tyrion waits but Jon doesnвЂ™t look at him.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: So our new king has chosen to send you to the NightвЂ™s Watch.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s still a NightвЂ™s Watch? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne"

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Just because winterвЂ™s over doesnвЂ™t mean it wonвЂ™t come again. You shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. (beat) The Unsullied wanted your head, of course. But Grey Worm has accepted the justice of a life sentence. (beat) Sansa and Arya wanted you freed, but they understand our king has to make peace. (beat) No oneвЂ™s very happy. Which means itвЂ™s a good compromise, I suppose. Tyrion steps closer to Jon.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: The world will always need a home for bastards and broken men. Jon nods.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Was it right? Tyrion stares at Jon, not quite sure he understands.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What I did.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: What we did.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It doesnвЂ™t feel right. Tyrion thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Ask me in ten years. He holds out his hand. Jon shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t expect weвЂ™ll ever see each other again. Tyrion smiles as he heads for the door. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 32.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I wouldnвЂ™t be so sure. A few years as Hand of the King will make anyone want to piss off the edge of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon exits the tower that once was his prison. Two NIGHTвЂ™S WATCHMEN wait for him. His escort to his li sentence at the Wall. Together, they walk along the battlements. Jon stops to look down on Blackwater Bay, far beneath him and sees the remaining ships of DanyвЂ™s fleet. Most are anchored, a few are still sailing in. From this vantage point, we can see the remaining Unsulli waiting to board with characteristic orderliness. The remaining Dothraki do the same; they have dismounted their horses, and walk them up gangplanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At sea level now, Jon passes a couple of Dothraki leading their horses. He looks up to a ship deck and sees Grey Wo [Jon continues walking, followed by his NightвЂ™s Watch guards. ] They make eye contact. Jon doesnвЂ™t say or do anything; knows Grey Worm hates him more than any man alive, and he understands why. Grey Worm turns away without acknowledging Jon. EXT. SHIPвЂ™S DECK - DAY Grey Worm walks to the helm. In the background, his men ( wearing helmets), raise the sails, pull in the gangplank, etc. An UNSULLIED CAPTAIN (no helmet) speaks to him in Valyria

dialogues.speaker: UNSULLIED CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Uni vali lis va loghor. (All the men have boarded.)

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: Syz. (Good. ) Grey Worm stares out towards the horizon. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 33.

dialogues.speaker: GREY WORM
dialogues.text: Suli va vвЂ™Ajo Naath. (We sail for the Isle of Naath.) The Captain nods and goes off to carry out his orders, leaving Grey Worm alone with his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon walks across the small beach, followed by the NightвЂ Watch guards. From behind, we can see the Stark siblings standing on th distant dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon stands in front of Sansa. He hasnвЂ™t entirely forgiv for betraying the oath he made her swear in the godswood.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: I wish there had been another way. (beat) IвЂ™m sorry it had to be you. Jon nods. He knows she loves him. He knows she only wants whatвЂ™s best for the North. But still...

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Can you forgive me? He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: The North is free, thanks to you. She accepts the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: But theyвЂ™ve lost their true king.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Ned StarkвЂ™s daughter will speak for them. SheвЂ™s the best they could ask for. Jon and Sansa embrace. Over SansaвЂ™s shoulder, Jon sees Arya crying. She hasnвЂ in years but she does now, for the brother she always lov most. He lets go of Sansa to embrace Arya, and she hugs him fiercely. He wipes her tears away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne"

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You can come and see me, you know, at Castle Black.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t. 34. Misunderstanding what she means, Jon manages a slight smi for his little sister.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You think anyone will dare tell you women arenвЂ™t allowed? But he misunderstands her:

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not going back north. News to Jon and Sansa both.

dialogues.speaker: SANSA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s west of Westeros? Jon and Sansa look at each other. They both failed geogra

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know.

dialogues.speaker: ARYA
dialogues.text: No one knows. It's where the maps stop. ThatвЂ™s where IвЂ™m going. Jon was not prepared for this. This is the last time he w ever see his favorite sibling.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You have your Needle? ItвЂ™s right there on her hip. She shows him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Wherever you go, IвЂ™m right there beside you. Jon kisses Arya on her forehead. Lastly, he steps over to Bran, kneels before the kingвЂ™s wheelchair and bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Your grace. (beat) IвЂ™m sorry I wasnвЂ™t there when you needed me. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 35.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: You were exactly where you were supposed to be. Hard to argue with omniscience. Jon stands and walks to t skiff thatвЂ™s waiting for him at the end of the pier. Tw SAILORS are there to row it, accompanied by the two NIGHT WATCHMEN. Jon climbs in. Together, Sansa, Arya and Bran watch their brother recede he heads toward the ship that will carry him to Eastwatch the Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cover of The White Book smacks the table, as Brienne flips it open. Wearing her new Kingsguard uniform, Brienne pages through book. We see the names on the pages: Ser Duncan the Tall. Ser Arthur Dayne. Ser Barristan Selm Finally, she finds it: Ser Jaime Lannister. JaimeвЂ™s page is brief and unfinished, as it was the las we saw it. Brienne dips a quill in ink and begins to write, to finis the rest of JaimeвЂ™s story. We watch her face as she doe catch snippets of her writing: ...took Riverrun without loss of life... outwitted the Targaryen forces to seize Highgarden... fought the Army o the Dead at Winterfell... died protecting his Queen. Brienne takes a moment to think about a man she both hate and loved, often at the same time. Then she collects herself, her duty done. She has somewhe important to be. She closes The White Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrion enters along the colonnade. The council chamber is empty, as is the map room. He looks out at the map, his sisterвЂ™s plan for world domination, smashed to pieces where the falling masonry h Then he turns and steps into the council chamber. He look the Hand emblem on the chair at the far side of the table Then down at the same emblem pinned to his chest. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 36.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sits in the HandвЂ™s chair. How the fuck did this happ How the fuck did he end up here, alive, with power he no longer wants or believes he deserves? He glances around at the other chairs surrounding the tab Hmm. He stands up and does some rearranging. HeвЂ™s not being theatrical about it like the time he dragged the chair to annoy Cersei. He just wants everything to be right this t Hearing approaching footsteps, he sits done again in the chair. The rest of the council arrives: SAMWELL TARLY, BRONN, Da He nods at them, and they nod back as they head to their seats. Davos sits to TyrionвЂ™s left, next to two empty c Across from Davos, Bronn sits next to another two empty chairs. Samwell carries a book. He wears the Grandmaester robes a chain with a single healing link.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s this? Sam drops the book down in front of Tyrion, its title embossed on its leather cover: A Song of Ice and Fire.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: A Song of Ice and Fire. Tyrion takes the book in hand.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: Archmaester Ebrose's history of the wars following the death of King Robert. (beat) I helped him with the title. Tyrion flips the book open and grins ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: I suppose I come in for some heavy criticism.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: I wouldnвЂ™t say that. Tyrion is surprised and gratified.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s kind to me? Well. I never would have guessed. He clocks SamвЂ™s nervous expression, and is confused. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 37.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: He isnвЂ™t kind.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: He... Sam isnвЂ™t sure how to put it.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: He what? What does he say about me?

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t believe you're mentioned. Tyrion pages through the book to verify his absence there God dammit! Hearing approaching footsteps and the squeaking of wheels Tyrion closes the book. Brienne and King Bran enter. A Kingsguard pushes Bran, an two more follow behind them. Brienne wears no helmet, but other three do. Everyone stands as they wheel Bran to the head of the tab

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Your grace. Everyone sits. Brienne sits down next to Bran. He surveys table.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: We appear to be missing a Master of Whisperers. And a Master of Laws. And a Master of War.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Yes, your grace. Suitable prospects will be brought to you for an audience in the coming weeks.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: And Drogon? Any word?

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: He was last spotted flying east.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: The farther away the better.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: Perhaps I can find him. Do carry on with the rest. That's weird. But so is the new king. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 38.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: As you wish, your grace.

dialogues.speaker: BRIENNE
dialogues.text: Ser Podrick? One of the Kingsguard steps forward: PODRICK PAYNE, in a Kingsguard uniform. He pulls Bran away from the head of t table, and they all rise.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: We serve at your pleasure, King Bran the Broken, Ruler of the Six Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm. With a sloppy lack of unison the group says:

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Long may he reign. Tyrion smiles apologetically at the young king.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: That will improve. Bran smiles slightly and nods.

dialogues.speaker: BRAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sure it will. Pod swings him around and pushes him from the room. Exit Bran. Everyone sits back down. Looking around the table, Tyrion gets down to business.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, Lord of Highgarden, Lord Paramount of the Reach and Master of Coin -- would you say the crownвЂ™s debt to you has been paid?

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: In full, my Lord Hand.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Good. Time to start incurring a new one. We have hungry people to feed. Can we expect some assistance in this regard?

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: Indeed we can. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 39.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Lord Davos, we have an armada to rebuild and ports to repair.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: We have. (looks at Bronn) These projects will begin at once, as soon as the Master of Coin and Lord of Lofty Titles provides funding.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: The Master of Coin looks forward to helping the Master of Ships. But first he has to insure weвЂ™re not wasting coin, or soon there won't be no more coin.

dialogues.speaker: DAVOS
dialogues.text: Any more.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: You Master of Grammar now, too? Moving on:

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: Grandmaester, it is my theory, based on my years of work on the Casterly Rock sewers, that clean water leads to a healthier population. Sam agrees and begins to expound.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve done some research on this subject [and it turns out]-- Bronn interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: The strong live and the weak don't.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: (ignoring Bronn) LetвЂ™s find the best builders and set them to the task. We begin to drift away from the table as these smart, experienced people plan a better future.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: Speaking of builders... all the best brothels burned down. The Master of Coin is willing to fund reconstruction. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brienne gives him a disapproving look. We pull back through the columns, and across the rubble- covered map room.

dialogues.speaker: SAMWELL
dialogues.text: Archmaester Ebrose is less than enthusiastic about the salutary effects of brothels.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: I imagine he isnвЂ™t using them properly.

dialogues.speaker: BRIENNE
dialogues.text: I think we can all agree that ships take precedence over brothels.

dialogues.speaker: BRONN
dialogues.text: I think that is a very presumptuous statement.

dialogues.speaker: TYRION
dialogues.text: You know, I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spring is coming, and it is slowly starting to warm up. The Wall weeps, as the temperature rises above freezing f the first time in many months. Looking down the Wall to Castle Black, three riders appro the castle gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NW BROTHER opens the gates of Castle Black to find a mounted Jon Snow and his companions. From atop his horse, Jon sees who is waiting for him on t balcony where Lord Commander Mormont used to stand: TORMU Jon and his companions enter the courtyard, and the gates close behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longclaw in its scabbard. JonвЂ™s hand reaches into frame takes it from the table.  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 4l.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands fasten a sword belt around a waist -- but the sword the belt is Needle, not Longclaw, and the hands belong to Arya (we do not see her face). Match cut on her hand to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A leather glove sliding onto SansaвЂ™s hand with the aid ATTENDANT. From here we move to shots of other costume pi being put on Sansa by the attendant, including leather ar pieces. We do not see SansaвЂ™s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon puts the last item in his pack and fastens it shut. W see a bit more of him, but at an oblique angle and/or shrouded in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see where Arya is for the first time: below decks on a ship. We see her obliquely as well, as she turns to the stairs and the light above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tilt down on Sansa as the final piece of her costume i put on. When the dresser steps away, we see Sansa unobstructed for the first time. Sansa stands, lifting her head from frame, and we match c to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jon puts on his cloak, we tilt up from his torso to hi face. Once again, he wears all black. It always was his color. He steps forward, and we pan with him as he wipes camera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Sansa down a Winterfell corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Jon down a Castle Black walkway.  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Arya down a shipвЂ™s corridor, up the stairs to the light. EXT. SHIPвЂ™S DECK - CONTINUOUS Arya emerges into the sunlight into a close up. She takes the scene for a beat, then steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re behind Sansa as she turns the corner into a room of Northern lords. She regards her new subjects as she approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon walks down the last few stairs to the ground level, w the last of the Free Folk await him: a few hundred men, w and children. Jon steps forward into the sea of waiting faces. There is suspicion in those faces, and no awe. Only trust. The Nig Watch used to hunt them, but they will follow this Night' Watchman. We follow Jon in profile as he passes through the wildlin to his left and his right (closer to camera). We match cu their passing vertical shapes to EXT. SHIPвЂ™S DECK - DAY Arya proceeding in profile down the deck, past deckhands, shipвЂ™s masts and riggings. A similar match cut to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sansa, as she moves down the center of the Great Hall, wi northern lords on either side of her. As she passes them, they drop to one knee and bow their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead shot tracking JonвЂ™s progress through the wildl EXT. SHIPвЂ™S DECK - DAY Matching overhead shot of Arya, as she approaches the bow  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matching overhead shot of Sansa, as she approaches the th at the end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon meets up with Tormund who is already on horseback. Someone else is waiting for him as well here: GHOST. The nuzzleвЂ™s Jon's face, and he pets the scruff of GhostвЂ™ Then Jon takes his horse from the NightвЂ™s Watchman hold it, and mounts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a shot mirroring the first image of the pilot, we see and Tormund through the grate of the tunnel as the gate rises, from a POV inside the tunnel. [We do not see the wildlings behind them. ] EXT. SHIPвЂ™S DECK - DAY On the bow of the ship, Arya steps into frame and looks w The Arya who left for Braavos was still a girl. This is a different person altogether. She has been No One. She has been Arya Stark of Winterfell. Who will she be next? We wrap around Arya and pull back down the deck as her sh sails west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrary motion to the above pull-back, we push down t aisle as someone puts a crown on SansaвЂ™s head. On either side of the camera, the lords rise to their fee and raise their swords to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: NORTHERN LORDS
dialogues.text: The Queen in the North! The Queen in the North! The Queen in the North! We clear the lords and continue to move into a close up o SansaвЂ™s face. The Queen in the North.  GAME OF THRONES вЂњThe Iron Throne" 44,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a two shot that mirrors another shot from the pilot, J and Tormund wait for the gate to finish opening. We see them emerge from the tunnel. Things still look ver similar to the pilot shots, except Ghost is with them. Then some Free Folk step into the fg, following them. Overhead, from the top of the wall, we see more emerge, following Jon and Tormund. And in a much wider side angle: Jon and Tormund with hund of Free Folk following behind them, walking away from the Wall. Many children are amongst them. They all cross the No ManвЂ™s Land between the Wall and t northern forest. Patches of grass show through what used be frozen tundra. Ghost lopes out ahead of Jon, as Jon rides toward camera. Tormund rides beside him, and the last of the Free Folk a behind them. Jon and company ride away from camera. As Ghost, Jon and rest cross the treeline, we slowly pull back, and watch t disappear into the forest.
